00079 int c_entry(void)
00080 {
00081 //      /* Initialize debug via UART0
00082 //       * – 115200bps
00083 //       * – 8 data bit
00084 //       * – No parity
00085 //       * – 1 stop bit
00086 //       * – No flow control
00087 //       */
00088 //      debug_frmwrk_init();
00089 //
00090 //      // print welcome screen
00091 //      print_menu();
00092 
00093         /* LCD block section -------------------------------------------- */
00094         GLCD_Init();
00095         GLCD_Clear(White);
00096 
00097         /* Update LCD Module display text. */
00098         GLCD_DisplayString(0,0, lcd_text[0] );
00099         GLCD_DisplayString(1,2, lcd_text[1] );
00100 
00101     /* Loop forever */
00102     while(1);
00103 }
00104 
00105 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00106    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00107    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00108    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00109    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00110 int main(void)
00111 {
00112     return c_entry();
00113 }
